result.execSummary:
The defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations are placed on a payment plan of $20 a month beginning 3/28/2017.
Obtain and maintain at least half-time employment.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
NO CONTACT JASMINE CONNORS
NO CONTACT JONATHON CONNORS
NO CONTACT WITH ASHLAND WALMART
NO CONTACT WITH RENO TORGERSON 
NO CONTACT WITH BONNIE CLAREMBOUX
Not to associate with any known herion or methamphetamine user except for purposes of counseling and/or treatment. 
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Granted Credit for Time Served 
Granted Work and Child Care Release 
Jail Time to commence immediately upon the completion of the sentences in 16CM52, 16CF163, 16CM127

records.addlTxt: Cases, 15CM122, 16CF103, 16CF113, 16CF157, 15CM252; 16CF14 Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin.; Def in treatment, started March 7, 2017; completed jail time; no violations at this time; Def asks about no contact w/Reno Torgerson, Ct needs written motion first;
from def, req to appear by telephone
of Withdrawal
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF157 and 16CF163 prelim hearing scheduled, Atty Rafferty waives prelim, wants to proceed to sentencing. Information filed, Atty Rafferty waives reading. 
Written offer to settle sets for the entire agreement of the parties. Charges and penalties read. Plea NC to 13 counts. Admits repeater. 
16cts DRI, Ct also notes uncharged offense.
Ct accepts pleas and finds def guilty. 
State has complied with vic rights.  Ct is not sure if will accept agreement of the parties. Ct questions. Parties comments on sentencing. Sentence entered as proposed in offer to settle (attached). PRH scheduled to file FDS. 
  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 08:00 am.
Offer to Settle
Notice of Requirements and Penalties under 941.29 and 941.291

Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty in court for Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson. Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson appeared by phone means. Rec copy of comp in 16CM157. Ct reads charges/penalties in 16CM163,157,127. No Waiver of time limits for prelim in 163 and 157.  Prelim 8/9 1:30 16CF163 and 16CF157 and STC on all others  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Rafferty does not know where client is. BOW bond ff

Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rec copy of compl. In 16CF113 ADA rec $1000 SB comply with TAD bail. Atty Rafferty, join in rec. $1000 SB comply with TAD, absol sob, get fingerprinted
Waives right to Prelim in 16CF113, Ct finds prob cause, bound over. Waives prelim in 16CF103, ct finds prob cause bound. Informations filed in both cases. Argn on each, waives reading, plea NG. 

  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Initial 16CF103, waives time limits for prelim. DAP. ADA discussion re bond/bail. 4/4/16 Ct modified to $2500 SB, new bond had TAD condition, did not include other conditions from previous bond ordered. Ct advises those still in place the TAD condition was added other conditions were not removed.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 04:15 pm.

3:30pm Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson in court by video with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty appr in person.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. New charges from this morning. Ct finds probable cause on new charges.  Atty Rafferty filed charges are progressing toward resolution. Comments on bail/bond, ADA asks for reinstatement of cash bond in other case. Atty Rafferty comments. $3000 SB follow TAD conditions (on new charges).  5/4/15 initial on new charges 11:30am-Status conf on all others.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 11:30 am.
TAD Bail Conditions
Comply with all conditions of bond
Comply with all conditions of bond

Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson by videa, attorney appr in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Rafferty Arraignment on most resent case and request to modify bond. 16CF14 waives reading of info, Stands Mute-NG entered. Atty Rafferty filed motion for modification of bail in all cases on Friday. Per Atty qualifies for TAD, requests to convert $500 cash bond to Signature bond. ADA asks for a high signature bond. CT orders cash bail modified to $2500 SB, TAD added to 15CM252, 15CM122, and 16CF14 along with all of the other non monitary conditions.
5/2 10:30am Defendant Raquel Marie Torgerson in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
